cards.name: Caterpie

abilities.name: Adaptive Evolution
abilities.text: This Pokémon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

cards.text: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antennae on its head to drive away enemies.

cards.name: Metapod

abilities.name: Adaptive Evolution
abilities.text: This Pokémon can evolve during your first turn or the turn you play it.

cards.text: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 60 or less.

cards.name: Butterfree
cards.text: It loves the honey of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.

attacks.name: Quiver Dance
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward. If you attached Energy in this way, heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Pineco
cards.text: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.

cards.name: Seedot
cards.text: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Nuzleaf
cards.text: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in forests.

cards.name: Shiftry

abilities.name: Leaf Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Grass Energy card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

cards.text: A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foe's mind and take preemptive action.

attacks.name: Deranged Dance
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.name: Roselia
cards.text: It uses the different poisons in each hand separately when it attacks. The stronger its aroma, the healthier it is.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Roserade
cards.text: Luring prey with a sweet scent, it uses poison whips on its arms to poison, bind, and finish off the prey.

attacks.name: Whiplash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Maractus
cards.text: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.

attacks.name: Exciting Shake
attacks.text: During your next turn, flip 6 coins instead of 2 for this Pokémon's Prickly Needles attack.

attacks.name: Prickly Needles
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Charizard-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Charizard-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Combustion Blast
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Combustion Blast during your next turn.

cards.name: M Charizard-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crimson Dive
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

cards.name: Ponyta
cards.text: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Rapidash
cards.text: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Torkoal
cards.text: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Fletchinder
cards.text: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Litleo
cards.text: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.

cards.name: Litleo
cards.text: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.

cards.name: Pyroar

abilities.name: Intimidating Mane
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Basic Pokémon.

cards.text: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.

attacks.name: Scorching Fang
attacks.text: You may discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Qwilfish

abilities.name: Counterattack Quills
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.text: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Feebas
cards.text: It eats anything, so it can even live in polluted streams and lakes. No one pays any attention to it.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Milotic

abilities.name: Energy Grace
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack) you may Knock Out this Pokémon. If you do, attach 3 basic Energy from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-EX).

cards.text: Milotic is breathtakingly beautiful. Those that see it are said to forget their combative spirits.

cards.name: Spheal
cards.text: They can't swim well yet, and they move much faster by rolling. When they're happy they clap fins.

cards.name: Sealeo
cards.text: It has a very sensitive nose. It touches new things with its nose to examine them.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Heal 60 damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Walrein
cards.text: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Big Tusk
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Luvdisc
cards.text: It lives in warm seas. It is said that a couple finding this Pokémon will be blessed with eternal love.

attacks.name: Heart Wink
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't draw a card at the beginning of his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Buizel
cards.text: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Floatzel
cards.text: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

attacks.name: Rescue
attacks.text: Shuffle 3 Pokémon from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Screw Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Bergmite
cards.text: It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.

attacks.name: Stomp Off
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Avalugg
cards.text: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.

attacks.name: Frost Barrier
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Shatter
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

cards.name: Shinx
cards.text: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Luxio
cards.text: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.

attacks.name: Electricounter
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage times the number of Prize cards your opponent has taken.

cards.name: Luxray
cards.text: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey–even those taking shelter behind a wall.

attacks.name: Fang Snipe
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Discard a Trainer card you find there.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Magnezone-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dual Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Helioptile
cards.text: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

attacks.name: Destructive Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Heliolisk
cards.text: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.

attacks.name: Parabolic Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Duskull
cards.text: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.

attacks.name: Revival
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from your opponent's discard pile onto his or her Bench.

attacks.name: Sneaky Placement
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Dusclops
cards.text: Anyone who dares peer into its body to see its spectral ball of fire will have their spirit stolen away.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Dusknoir

abilities.name: Shadow Void
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to this Pokémon.

cards.text: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.

attacks.name: Pain Pellets
attacks.text: Put damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon equal to the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Toxicroak-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Triple Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Smash Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Espurr
cards.text: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Meowstic
cards.text: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.

attacks.name: Ear Influence
attacks.text: Move as many damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon as you like to any of your opponent's other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Skrelp
cards.text: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Geodude
cards.text: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Graveler
cards.text: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Golem
cards.text: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Explosion
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 100 damage to itself.

cards.name: Binacle
cards.text: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Barbaracle
cards.text: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.

attacks.name: Rock Rush
attacks.text: Discard as many Fighting Energy cards as you like from your hand. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

cards.name: Sneasel
cards.text: It feeds on eggs stolen from nests. Its sharply hooked claws rip vulnerable spots on prey.

cards.text: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.

attacks.name: Claw Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Stunky
cards.text: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Stunky
cards.text: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.

cards.name: Skuntank
cards.text: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.

attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Sandile
cards.text: It moves along below the sand's surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Krokorok
cards.text: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.

attacks.name: Dark Clamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Double Swing
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Scraggy
cards.text: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling it skin up to its neck.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Scrafty
cards.text: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Forretress

abilities.name: Thorn Tempest
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: It is encased in a steel shell. Its peering eyes are all that can be seen of its mysterious innards.

attacks.name: Iron Crash
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

cards.name: Durant
cards.text: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.

attacks.name: Chip Off
attacks.text: Discard cards from your opponent's hand at random until he or she has 4 cards in his or her hand.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Flabébé
cards.text: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.

cards.text: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.

attacks.name: Petal Blizzard

cards.name: Spritzee

cards.name: Carbink
cards.text: Born from temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.

attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Druddigon
cards.text: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

cards.name: Dragalge

abilities.name: Poison Barrier
abilities.text: Your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.text: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Goomy
cards.text: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn't dry out.

attacks.name: Gooey
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Sliggoo
cards.text: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can't see anything.

attacks.name: Gooey
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.text: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.

attacks.name: Heavy Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Pidgey
cards.text: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Pidgeotto
cards.text: The claws on its feet are well developed. It can carry prey such as an Exeggcute to its nest over 60 miles away.

attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Pidgeot
cards.text: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Asleep, flip 2 coins instead of 1 between turns. If either of them is tails, this Pokémon is still Asleep.

cards.text: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

attacks.name: Sleepy Press
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Sentret
cards.text: When acting as a lookout, it warns others of danger by screeching and hitting the ground with its tail.

cards.name: Furret

cards.name: Miltank
cards.text: If it is around babies, the milk it produces contains much more nutrition than usual.

cards.name: Buneary

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Magnezone-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dual Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Toxicroak-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Triple Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 3 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Smash Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Kangaskhan-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Triple Draw
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Kindred Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Lysandre
cards.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Pokémon Center Lady
cards.text: Heal 60 damage and remove all Special Conditions from 1 of your Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Pokémon Fan Club
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: M Charizard-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crimson Dive
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

cards.name: M Charizard-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Wild Blaze
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

cards.name: M Kangaskhan-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Wham Bam Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.
